articles.title: Soft robotic, wearable device improves walking for individual with Parkinson's disease - Medical Xpress
articles.description: Freezing is one of the most common and debilitating symptoms of Parkinson's disease, a neurodegenerative disorder that affects more than 9 million people worldwide. When individuals with Parkinson's disease freeze, they suddenly lose the ability to move their…

articles.author: Dr. Russell Moul
articles.title: Evolution May Not Be As Random As Previously Thought - IFLScience
articles.description: New research challenges the long-held idea that evolution is always random and could have massive implications for addressing real-world issues.
articles.content: The theory of evolution by natural selection is robust and well-evidenced, but that doesnt mean we are not learning new things about how life develops and changes over time. A new study has found tha… [+3421 chars]
